text: Brian Arthur Greenhalgh (born 20 February 1947) is an English former professional footballer born in Chesterfield, Derbyshire, who played as a striker in the Football League for Preston North End, Aston Villa, Leicester City, Huddersfield Town, Cambridge United, Bournemouth, Torquay United and Watford during the 1960s and 1970s. Although retired Brian is currently a part-time scout for Newcastle United, and has scouted for Everton, Watford and Aston Villa.
